result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph E. Grams Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Dodge Cty DNA Proof of Submission

15CF295 & 15CF418 - Defendant Joseph E Grams in court with attorney Randall E Doyle.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def on waiver of prelim in 15CF418;  court accepts waiver.  State files amended information, amending charge to misd.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens in both cases.  NC plea entered in count 2 of 15CF295 and NC plea entered in count 1 of 15CF418 as amended.  Court accepts both pleas.  Count 1 is Dismissed in 15CF295 and Counts 3 & 4 are DRI.  State heard on sentencing recomendations.  Atty Doyle responds.  
BAC - .14.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

15CF295:
w/held sentence
18 mos probation
5 days DCJ as COP
12 mos rev & ig interlock
$400 + costs including blood draw to BD hospital
provide DNA sample
maintain absolute sobriety


15CF418:
w/held sentence
18 mos probation w/same conditions - no jail
court costs

Defendant, Joseph E. Grams in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like Atty Doyle, defendant is employed, defendant has another case, court appoints Atty Doyle, court orders a wage assignment, continuation of the payment plan ordered in the other case the defendant has.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:17 - Defendant, Joseph E. Grams in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:15 am.
